questions.question: There ……………………… a hole in my socks.
questions.description: When the noun that follows there is singular, the verb is singular.

questions.question: There ………………………….. lots of mangoes on the tree.
questions.description: When the noun that follows there is plural, the verb is plural.

questions.question: There ………………………… many people in the waiting room.
questions.description: When the noun that follows there is plural, the verb is plural.

questions.question: There ………………………. a lot of people coming.
questions.description: When the noun that follows there is plural, the verb is plural.

questions.question: There …………………………. lots of applicants.
questions.description: When the noun that follows there is plural, the verb is plural.

questions.question: There ……………………….. a lot of noise in the street.
There ……………………….. two cops at the door.
questions.description: When the noun that follows there is plural, the verb is plural.

questions.question: There ……………………………. some apples in the fridge.
questions.description: When the noun that follows there is plural, the verb is plural.

questions.question: ……………………….. there anybody at home?
questions.description: Use a singular verb with anybody.

questions.question: There ………………………. some people in the room.
questions.description: When the noun that follows there is plural, the verb is plural.

questions.question: There ………………………. nothing left to do.
questions.description: Use a singular verb with nothing.

questions.question: There ……………………….. no clean clothes to wear.
questions.description: When the noun that follows there is plural, the verb is plural.
